thread.title: 1st Forklift and Pallet Building Competition at Narita Airport Set to be Held on Thursday, 27 AugustTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: 1st Forklift and Pallet Building Competition at Narita Airport Set to be Held on Thursday, 27 AugustTravelandtourworld.com
text:
1st Forklift and Pallet Building Competition at Narita Airport Set to be Held on Thursday, 27 August Published
Narita International Airport, which handles approximately 60% of the international air cargo traffic in Japan, will sponsor the “1st Forklift and Pallet Building Competition at Narita Airport” this summer. The competition has two main objectives:
(1) to expand the airport’s overall volume of cargo handled by encouraging cargo handling operators to compete and improve their skills, thus offering users better services; and
(2) to contribute to ensuring safety at work and preventing on-the-job accidents in the Cargo Area by raising safety awareness among airport workers and promoting improvements in quality. The details of the event are as described below.
* Japanese companies achieved excellent results at the Hactl International Forklift and Pallet Building Competition held in January 2015 at Hong Kong International Airport, where a Japanese firm became the overall winner. This competition aims to promote further improvements in skills.
Source:- Narita International Airport
